Name: da3c6bc5442bd6bd05db7fd73a2a31b3
Position: Postdoctoral Associate at New York University • iGEM Alumnus
Location: New York, New York, United States
Experience: [['Postdoctoral Associate', 'New York University', 'Feb 2018 - Present · 4 yrs 4 mos', 'New York'], ['PhD Student in Systems Biology/Ecology/Biophysics', 'Université Paris Diderot', 'Nov 2013 - Nov 2017 · 4 yrs 1 mo', 'Paris Area, France', 'Growth, differentiation and self-organization of S. cerevisiae colonies in controlled spatially structured dynamically changing environments'], ['Science Teacher', 'CRI - Centre de Recherches Interdisciplinaires', 'Feb 2015 · 1 mo', 'Paris Area, France', 'Chemical Environment Sensing, Bachelor level'], ['CRI - Centre de Recherches Interdisciplinaires', '1 yr 11 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'Mentor of the iGEM Paris Bettencourt 2014 team', 'Jan 2014 - Nov 2014 · 11 mos', 'Microbiome Engineering project "The Smell of Us" (Best New Application Project and Best Supporting Art & Design awards) http://2014.igem.org/Team:Paris_Bettencourt "Body odor is caused by the metabolic action of bacteria on human sweat. Existing deodorants are antibiotic - they kill all skin bacteria including neutral and beneficial species. Where body odor carries a social stigma, alternatives to deodorant are few. The iGEM Paris Bettencourt 2014 project explores new ways to control body odors through precise modifications of the living microbiome. We target common odors of the armpit and foot, as well as odors specific to old age or genetic disease. We present a BioBrick smell library for mixing genetic perfumes and a CRISPR-mediated technology for isolating naturally odorless bacterial strains."', 'Science Teacher', '2013 - 2014 · 1 yr', 'Practical course in Genetics, Bachelor level', 'Mentor of the iGEM Paris Bettencourt 2013 team', 'Jan 2013 - Nov 2013 · 11 mos', 'Infectious Disease Control project "Fight Tuberculosis with Modern Weapons" (Grand Prize winner and Best Health & Medicine Project award) http://2013.igem.org/Team:Paris_Bettencourt "To defeat tuberculosis, we need new biotechnology. Our work adds 4 new tools to the anti-TB medical armamentarium. Detect - a CRISPR-based biosensor delivered by phage and sequence-specific for antibiotic resistance. Target - an E. coli model hosting an essential mycobacterial metabolic pathway that could simplify drug screening. Infiltrate - an E. coli strain capable of entering infected macrophages and lysing mycobacteria. Sabotage - a non-lytic phage that spreads horizontally in a bacterial population and expresses an siRNA to knock down antibiotic resistance."'], ['Student Internship', 'Université Paris Diderot', 'Jan 2013 - Jun 2013 · 6 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'Systems Biology and Biophysics / Modelling Biological Systems project "Yeast growth in gradient of glucose within a 2D assembly of cells"'], ['Student member of the iGEM Paris Bettencourt 2012 team', 'CRI - Centre de Recherches Interdisciplinaires', 'Jan 2012 - Nov 2012 · 11 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'Genetically Engineered Organisms Containment project "bWARE: How safe is safe enough?" (2nd Runner-up overall and Best Environment Project award) http://2012.igem.org/Team:Paris_Bettencourt "Synthetic biologists, and iGEM teams in particular, design Genetically Engineered Organisms (GEOs) to benefit people and communities around the world. However, many proposed applications necessarily involve the deployment of GEOs in natural environments. These dreams can never be made real without technical, legal and ethical guidelines for the use of GEOs outside the lab. Our project addresses this serious need from our perspective as safety bioengineers, citizens and humans. We have developed the bWARE containment module to substantially reduce the risk of Horizontal Gene Trasfer (HGT) while remaining compatible with existing iGEM devices. A GEO may first perform its beneficial function during a programmed delay. Then our system activates, irreversibly degrading DNA throughout the population, leaving no genetic information behind. Experience: [['Research Project', 'Université de Paris · Internship', 'Jan 2021 - Jun 2021 · 6 mos', 'Paris, Île-de-France, France', 'From January to June 2021, I was part of the Challenge Hub, an initiative by the Learning Planet Institute (formerly known as the Center of Research & Interdisciplinarity) and l\'Université de Paris. The Challenge Hub is "a space that invites masters students to deploy their projects and focus on their social impact while developing their scientific training." My project researched trauma from a multidisciplinary lens (the fields of psychology, sociology, transcultural psychiatry & neuroscience) and how to heal collective trauma through social healing and somatic therapies. I co-created a 4-hour workshop, "In Relation" as a prototype, which used movement, music and social sharing of emotions to reflect on the COVID-19 pandemic. I collected data to measure the effects on well-being and group connection between participants. This workshop was created for students at the CRI, as well as the public from non-profit organizations. Its format has since inspired more workshops on well-being hosted at other third-places.', 'Challenge Hub', 'The project is mentioned in the plan of studies as an alternative to an internship. Students interested in Challenge Hub must apply before the official start of the courses of the corresponding semester. Name: 804bab8ab5ec5031fdba9bfecaffad25
Position: PhD Candidate at Participatory Memory Practices (POEM) Network
Experience: [['PHD Fellow', 'POEM - H2020 Project', 'Oct 2018 - Present · 3 yrs 8 mos', 'London, United Kingdom', "During my research project I will be working with Ashoka Changemaker Schools in Europe, seeking to understand what forms of social organization support making memories for future possibilities among young people, building upon inclusive public memory. More precisely, I will study competences, practices, and attitudes developed inside these schools that have the potential to empower young people and build upon participatory and inclusive memory practices. My PhD runs as part of the European Training Network “Participatory Memory Practices: Concepts, strategies, and media infrastructures for envisioning socially inclusive potential futures of European Societies through culture” (POEM)* alongside another 12 PhD projects. All research projects are funded by the Marie-Skłodowska-Curie ITN Action as part of the H2020 Programme of the European Commission. Lead Supervisors: @Ross Hall (director of Ashoka's education strategy) & Prof Dr Gertraud Koch (Professor of European Ethnology/Cultural Anthropology at Universität Hamburg). *POEM is a consortium of high profile universities, acknowledged memory institutions, civil society organizations, and SMEs located in Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Sweden, and the UK.", 'Project Outline', 'The ETN addresses the need of experts in the heritage sector.'], ['Community Lead', 'Ashoka UK & Ireland', 'Oct 2018 - Dec 2021 · 3 yrs 3 mos', 'London, England, United Kingdom', 'Community Lead for the UK Changemaker School network.', 'Ashoka Changemaker Schools | Ashoka | Everyone a Changemaker', 'Over the last eight years, Ashoka has identified and brought together 300 of the world’s most innovative schools and recognised them as Changemaker Schools. This network of educators and schools align around a shared vision: to empower children and...'], ['Program Evaluator', 'CRI - Centre de Recherches Interdisciplinaires · Internship', 'Mar 2018 - Jul 2018 · 5 mos', 'Paris Area, France', "Savanturiers is an educational program working for the establishment of research-based education (éducation par la recherche) in school, aiming to develop students' critical thinking, their willigness to explore the unkown and collaborate with each other through linking researchers to classrooms. My 4-month internship at Savanturiers will focus on evaluating the social impact of teaching engineering and digital skills through a research-based approach (éducation par la recherche). Through interviews, observations and questionnaires, qualitative and quantitative data analysis, I will finally redact the project evaluation report through collaboration with students, teachers and mentors-researchers following the program. https://les-savanturiers.cri-paris.org/"], ['Continuing Education Coordinator', 'Codesign-it! · Internship', 'Oct 2017 - Feb 2018 · 5 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'Codesign-it! is a collective of 46 independent members and a network of partners and resources all around Europe that uses design methods to engage people into learning and different ways of working while transforming the design and management of complex organizations or projects by facilitating collaborative innovation. My five-month internship at Codesign-it! was focused on documentation, communication and project communication, summarized in the following deliverables: Orchestration of logic model collaborative redaction; Program starter guide redaction; Communication video script co-redaction and editing; Participation in the Codesign University Diploma educational team and design and co-facilitation of sessions; Documentation of pretotyping sessions.'], ['Student Mentor', 'SDGo Competition', 'Apr 2017 - Jun 2017 · 3 mos', 'Beijing City, China', 'The SDGo Competition is a challenge-based competition targeting at the 17 Sustainable Development Goals proposed by the United Nations. This project was launched for the first time in Beijing, China, from the SDGo team. My role in the project was to facilitate the launching of the competition (in Beijing) and mentor a team of students throughout their SDG-related project. Link to the project: https://cri-paris.org/research-projects/sdgo-competition/'], ['Workshop Facilitator', 'Open Science School', 'Jan 2017 - Jun 2017 · 6 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'Open tools for Science Education and Research. Science Education and Research should be shared freely between educators, learners, and communicators. In OSS, we work together with schools, teachers, designers, and all sort of geeks to create open-source common resources, creative workshops, classes, or hardware. http://openscienceschool.org/'], ['Education Officer', 'Doing It Together Science · Internship', 'Jan 2017 - Jun 2017 · 6 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'DITOs (Doing It Together science) is a a three-year EU citizen science project aiming to communicate, coordinate and support citizen science activities. From top-down projects in which people join an activity that is designed and coordinated by scientists, to bottom-up science activities, also known as DIY (Do-It-Yourself) science, the project promotes public and policy engagement with citizen science through a wide range of events and activities. My six-month internship at DIToS was focused on public engagement & capacity building through communication and project dissemination; networking with European policy and decision-makers; event management and evaluation; co-responsible for the organisation & facilitation of Biodesign activities in high-schools, makerspaces and universities.'], ['City Manager', 'Sofar Sounds', 'Mar 2016 - Aug 2016 · 6 mos', 'Thessaloniki, Greece', 'Sofar sounds is a global network of secret music gigs hosted in private and cultural venues and giving stage to various artists from the local and the global scene. Experience: [['PHD Researcher', 'Université Grenoble Alpes · Contract', 'Nov 2017 - Dec 2021 · 4 yrs 2 mos', 'Grenoble, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes, France', '- Developed and evaluated a Text-to-Movie authoring system that enables anatomy teachers to create and edit animated video lessons. - Incorporated principles of movie-making such as cinematography and storyboarding into an automated content creation pipeline. - Designed systems to gamify anatomy lessons in the form of interactive text based games by using ink by inkle studios. - Created a domain-specific authoring language that is parsed in Python to generate Finite State Machines and Petrinets which are executed in a Unity application.'], ['Design Intern for Trivia games', 'CRI · Internship', 'Jul 2017 - Sep 2017 · 3 mos', 'Paris, Île-de-France, France', '-Researched and wrote all the questions for "Pin My State", a trivia game to learn about India\'s rich diversity. -Tested the game in a Bangalore based startup and used the feedback to help the design team streamline the game mechanics before the release. - The game is now being used as a team-building exercise in Indian companies to promote diversity and inclusion', 'Becoming a quiz show master - writing trivia for Pin My State By Ameya\xa0Murukutla', 'How many of us have watched a quiz show on TV and thought that the questions were ridiculously easy to write? Name: d42d34ad15dd9e556a235cec3d444056
Position: Early-stage researcher
Location: Pamplona, Chartered Community of Navarre, Spain
Experience: [['Project Associate', 'Indian Institute of Science (IISc) · Full-time', 'Feb 2019 - Jul 2020 · 1 yr 6 mos', 'Bangalore'], ['Intern', 'National University of Singapore', 'Apr 2017 - Jun 2017 · 3 mos', 'Singapore', 'Collective cell adhesion and movement give rise to complex changes in multicellular tissue structures, including epithelial regeneration, the sprouting of vessels and ducts in angiogenesis and branching morphogenesis. The deregulated invasion of cell masses during cancer progression and consecutive tissue destruction, integrate both adhesion to the ECM and to neighbouring cell. During processes like these, active traction forces are exerted through cell‐cell contacts that can induce different types of movements such as the sliding of neighbouring cells as well as global motion of many cells, correlated with dynamical rearrangements of cell‐cell junctions. As most of the mechanotransduction studies have been performed at the level of single living cell and restricted to cell‐ECM interactions, the mechanical processes controlling the assembly, maintenance and dissociation of adherent junctions involved in multicellular systems remain poorly understood. The project aims at understanding how external constraints such as substrate stiffness, geometry as well as intercellular interactions affect collective cell behaviours and lead to complex tissue organisation. I would be involved in developing micro- and nanofabricated tools and micromanipulation to control the mechanical environment of cells. These tools will be combined with molecular approaches and advanced techniques in light microscopy to study the influence of physical properties of the environment on collective cell migration and the organization of epithelial layers.'], ['Intern', 'Institut Curie - Research Centre', 'Nov 2016 - Mar 2017 · 5 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'Project- Extracellular matrix organization in Mesentry. The mesenteric ECM of a healthy mouse is composed of two peritoneal basement membranes composed of type IV collagen and laminin, with a fibrillar collagen layer in between. Tumor invaded mesenteries show a dramatic change in type I collagen organization when compared to normal mesentry. I will be working on translating these results invitro by seeding tumoroids on mice mesentry isolated from wild type mice. Later, quantifying the changes in alignment of the collagen with the help of the software Curvalign.'], ['iGEM 2016 Paris Bettencourt', 'Inserm', 'Jul 2016 - Oct 2016 · 4 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'The aim of our project was to produce synthetic enzymes that can remove red wine stains from fabric. These enzymes are intended to be part of a product to replace perchloroethylene (PERC), a toxic solvent currently used in dry cleaning that will be banned in France for 2022. We isolated microbes capable of degrading red wine from a library of 186 strains taken from vineyard soil samples collected around the world. The most effective microbes were submitted for whole genome sequencing and then analyzed to produce a short list of candidate stain-fighting enzymes. We then fused these enzymes with fabric binding domains (FBDs) to improve their efficiency. I was mainly involved in identifying short peptides (FBDs) with affinity to cotton, linen, wool, polyester and silk using the method of phage display. The resulting Fabric Binding Domains (FBDs) were quantitatively characterized using ELISA, to determine peptides with optimal affinity that can improve enzymatic activity.'], ['Intern', 'Institut Pasteur', 'Feb 2016 - Jun 2016 · 5 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'Role of alpha N catenin in the control of Microtubules in cell polarity and migration- Cell polarity and Migration plays an important role in tissue morphogenesis and wound healing. In most migrating cells, the nucleus – centrosome axis corresponds to the front-rear axis of cell polarity, with the centrosome pointing toward the leading edge. Cadherin-based cell-cell contacts have been implicated in the control of cell polarity both in migrating and immobile cells.However, the molecular mechanisms downstream of alpha-N catenin - which is downstream of N cadherin - that controls MT acetylation and centrosome positioning are not very clear. During my internship, I have investigated how alpha-N catenin controls microtubule-dependent centrosome positioning. I used micropatterned substrates to impose reproducible cell–cell interactions and wound healing to study the impact of alpha-N catenin expression on MT recruitment and post-translational modification near cell-cell contacts. Micropatterns allow one to induce polarization of cells in the absence of migration, hence distinguish between proteins involved in cell migration and polarity.'], ['Junior Research Fellow', 'Centre for Chemical Biology and Therapeutics, InStem', 'Jun 2014 - Aug 2015 · 1 yr 3 mos', 'Bangalore', 'Our project at CCBT involves targeting molecular recognition by domains-which recognize the binding/ interacting partner via site-specific post-translational modification- using selective small molecule inhibitors as a new approach for selective modulation of intracellular signaling mechanisms. I have been involved in developing a cascade of cellular assays like Phenotypic foci formation assay, G2 arrest assay, orthogonal assays and clonogenic assay for the discovery of lead compounds that target these domains to modulate the cellular DNA damage response (DDR). These assays are designed to assess target engagement and selectivity in the cellular milieu and are benchmarked using genetic methods.'], ['Student Trainee', 'National centre for Biological sciences', 'Jul 2013 - Apr 2014 · 10 mos', 'Bangalore', '•\tCharacterizing a lab identified cancer marker (CD66) along with CD49f in Caski cell line (Metastastic Squamous cell cervical carcinoma) by other markers(stem,differentiation) like sox2, oct4 etc. and also by treating them with TGF beta, SB (GSK 3 beta inhibitor), Dapt (Notch inhibitor). •\tAlso looked the role of TGF beta in the induction of Epithelial to Mesenchymal Transition (specifically Partial EMT) in the context of CD66 expression.']]
Education: [['Centro de Investigación Médica Aplicada', 'Doctor of Philosophy - PhD, Cancer research', '2020 - 2024'], ['Learning Planet Institute', 'AIV Master, Life sciences', '2015 - 2017'], ['PES Institute of Technology (PES University now)', "Bachelor's degree, Biotechnology", '2009 - 2013', 'Grade: 8.84/10', 'Activities and societies: Organizing commitee member - "Ninadaa", Gifted Student Development Program (GSDP), Campaign Team - National Conference on Olfaction and Electronic Nose, Volunteer - Youth for Seva, Volunteer - NGO Samiksha Foundation.'], ['Canara Pre University College', 'Pre - University Examination, PCMB', '2007 - 2009', 'Grade: 89%'], ['Centro de Investigación Médica Aplicada', 'Doctor of Philosophy - PhD']]

Le Comité des Urgences assure donc notamment la réalisation et le suivi des recommandations concernant l'accueil, la prise en charge hospitalière et pré-hospitalière des urgences dans le cadre des missions traditionnelles assurées par les Anesthésistes Réanimateurs."], ['Professeur agrégé', 'Ecole du Val-de-Grâce', 'Apr 2018 - Present · 4 yrs 2 mos', 'Paris, France', "L’École du Val-de-Grâce fédère l'ensemble de l'enseignement et de la formation des différents personnels du Service de santé des armées, praticiens, infirmiers et techniciens militaires ou civils."], ['Professeur agrégé', 'Collège National des Enseignants d’Anesthésie Réanimation', 'Sep 2018 - Present · 3 yrs 9 mos', "CNEAR | Collège National des Enseignants d'Anesthésie-Réanimation", "Retrouver tout le matériel pédagogique élaboré par les professeurs du collège national des enseignants d'anesthésie - réanimation. L'Anesthésie-Réanimation (CNEAR) est traitée dans l'UE11 « Urgences et défaillances viscérales aiguës » ainsi que dans..."], ['Collaborateur', 'iLUMENS', 'Sep 2011 - Present · 10 yrs 9 mos', '« iLUMENS » is a Medical Teaching University Laboratory based on Digital Technologies and Simulations, multidisciplinary and targeting medical training, specialized training and continuing education, proposed at the University of Paris-Descartes and its School of Medicine. http://www.ilumens.fr/en/'], ['Anesthésiste Réanimateur', '14ème Antenne Chirurgicale Parachutiste', 'Oct 2014 - Sep 2016 · 2 yrs', "L'antenne chirurgicale est une unité médicale opérationnelle de rôle 2 : elle est déployée sur le terrain pour pratiquer la réanimation et des gestes chirurgicaux de sauvetage afin de stabiliser le blessé avant son évacuation. http://www.defense.gouv.fr/sante/le-ssa-en-operation/prise-en-charge-d-un-blesse/prise-en-charge-d-un-blesse"], ['Anesthésiste Réanimateur', "Hôpital d'Instruction des Armées Bégin", 'Sep 2012 - Aug 2015 · 3 yrs'], ['Approches Interdisciplinaires du Vivant', 'Centre de Recherches Interdisciplinaires', 'Sep 2012 - Jul 2013 · 11 mos', 'Région de Paris, France', 'The CRI The Center for Research and Interdisciplinarity (Centre de Recherches Interdisciplinaires – CRI) in Paris was founded in 2005 as a convivial place at the crossroad of life sciences and exact, natural, cognitive, and social sciences. Today, the CRI offers three degree programs integrated in the Bettencourt curriculum: an undergraduate program (Licence Frontières du Vivant, FdV, Paris-Descartes University), a masters program (Interdisciplinary Approaches to Life Sciences, AIV Master, Paris-Descartes University, Paris-Diderot University), and a doctoral program (Frontiers of Life, Ecole doctorale 474 Frontières du Vivant, FdV). The CRI’s dedicated facilities host visiting professors, a variety of courses, and many student clubs. The CRI’s main role is to promote new educational techniques and strategies to empower the students to take initiative and develop their own research projects. Mentors, research institutions, private companies, and foundations, such as the Bettencourt Foundation, provide the support for the student-created research projects and activities. The aforementioned activities range from the first French synthetic biology team (iGEM Paris Bettencourt, for the MIT-sponsored iGEM (international genetically engineered machine) competition) to the Paris-Montagne Science Festival, and the Science Académie, an outreach program that allows high schools students from underprivileged neighborhoods to discover their creativity in science. The CRI cofounders, François Taddei and Ariel Lindner, have produced many publications in general-interest scientific journals, and their research endeavors have been recognized by several awards. François Taddei is a member of various working groups on the future of research and education (France 2025, OECD report, etc.), and he has been nominated at the French High Council for Education in 2012.'], ['Praticien Confirmé', 'Ecole du Val de Grâce', 'Sep 2007 - Aug 2012 · 5 yrs']]
Education: [['Paris Diderot and Paris Descartes universities', 'AIV master of science (MSc), Life science', '2012 - 2013', 'The AIV Master of Paris Diderot and Paris Descartes universities is an interdisciplinary two-year program tackling with quantitative approaches different interfaces with Life Sciences. It aims at training creative and talented students to develop their research in an environment as enriching as the best world graduate programs.'], ['Pierre and Marie Curie University', 'PostGraduate Degree, Anesthesiology and Intensive Care', '2007 - 2012'], ['Université de Bordeaux', 'Doctor of Medicine (MD)', '1996 - 2005'], ['École de Santé Navale', 'Doctor of Medicine (MD), Medicine', '1996 - 2005']]

Name: bcc6c431ce8eed1a27be0df532d9b7e1
Position: Scientist at PreviPharma
Experience: [['Scientist (Systems Biologist)', 'PreviPharma', 'Jun 2020 - Present · 2 yrs', 'Mannheim, Baden-Württemberg, Germany', 'My research is based on Clinical Immuno Microbiology and dealing with omics data set. The research objective is to combat AMR using the patient’s own innate immunity arm in combination with antibiotics.'], ['Research Engineer', 'Health Lab - CRI Paris · Full-time', 'Oct 2019 - Mar 2020 · 6 mos', 'Paris', 'In this project, we study how team interactions and team diversity impact the performance of iGEM teams and the learning experience of the students. How do students collaborate? How are subgroups formed withint is the frequency of interactions with mentors/PIs? How do these interactions lead to better learning (skill spreading), productivity (BioBricks produced / project size), creativity (project uniqueness) or just success in the competition (medals, prizes, winners)? To answer these questions, we are partnering with iGEM teams to conduct a quantitative, large-scale study, using several methods: Questionnaires. We prepared questionnaires to be filled by team members at the 3 time points during the project. They allow us to better understand the team process and diversity! Communication metadata. The analysis of the metadata (user-timestamp) from communication networks (Slack, WhatsApp, E-mail, etc.) at the end of the project allows to better understand the communication flows within the team. Proximity experiment. Lastly, we built a smartphone application that allows to measure interactions of team members in the lab through bluetooth. By using the application on certain days during the study, we can reconstruct team interaction networks in the lab! All this data is anonymised, kept secured on a server, and participation to each data collection is completely voluntary. After the wiki freeze we provide a report summarizing some general analytics of the team (networks of interaction, number of interactions etc).'], ['Research Assistant', 'CRI · Full-time', 'Dec 2018 - Sep 2019 · 10 mos', 'Paris, Ile-de-France, France', 'The Global Action Plan for AMR has identified five objectives to address this scourge. The first two objectives – “ (a) Improve awareness and understanding of antimicrobial resistance through effective communication, education and training (b) Strengthen the knowledge and evidence base through surveillance and research” are the basis of the current proposal which aims to address these using genomics and artificial intelligence tools.'], ['Research Intern', 'DNA Electronics', 'May 2018 - Aug 2018 · 4 mos', 'London, Royaume-Uni', 'Molecular Assay Screening for Pathogen Identification The rise of antimicrobial resistance (AMR) has increased the need for diagnostic tools to rapidly detect AMR infections. The speed of detection for a bloodstream infection (BSI) and associated AMRs can have a significant impact on patient survival. Traditional blood culture tests can take 2-6 days before an actionable result is obtained. A faster, molecular based approach can reduce this time from days to hours leading to improved and informed treatment being administered. An integrated sample to answer system has been designed and developed with a panel of clinically relevant PCR based assays for the screening of BSI pathogens and AMR genes. The panel’s targets include highly prevalent BSI pathogens such as S. aureus, K. pneumoniae, C. albicans, E. faecalis and A. baumannii. Detection of prevalent AMR genes include methicillin resistance genes mecA/C, vancomycin resistance genes vanA/B and Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase (KPC). A selection of targets in this panel have been demonstrated in both 1CFU/ml of spiked samples and clinical specimens in a modular workflow. This workflow contains a purification process that captures pathogens and extracts the target DNA, a nested multiplex PCR pre-amplification, and detection on chip using pH sensing complementary metal oxide semiconductor technology. As AMR becomes prevalent, an expansion of the current panel to increase the quantity of detectable AMR genes is currently underway with bioinformatics analysis and primer designs in process. This would expand the current panel to include AMR gene variants of CTX-M, OXA, IMP, VIM and NDM. Methodical screening of this new list of targets is to be undertaken and will include a high-throughput primer screen, subsequent nested screening of high performance, compatible primer pairs, and combining the primers with the multiplex pre-amplification of the original panel targets for detection .'], ['Research Internship', 'GCS PITIE SALPETRIERE HOPITAL DES GARDIENS DE LA PAIX · Full-time', 'Jan 2018 - Mar 2018 · 3 mos', 'Paris, Île-de-France, France', 'Systems biology and network analysis of autoimmune and inflammatory disorders (RNAseq data). Classical approaches use differentially expressed genes in order to identify gene modulation between groups. Gene signature (GS) detection has been performed between each disease group and HD as well as differential gene expression (DEG) using an automatized pipeline. Transimmunom (NCT02466217) which aims at studying nineteen autoimmune and inflammatory disorders. The final goal is to guide the development of novel and redefine the nosography of autoimmune and autoinflammatory diseases. Our current strategy is to integrate clinical and “omics” data to identify and understand the complexity of the immune responses underlying these immunopathologies by applying a systems biology apprintegratedIn particular, we focused our investigations on processing, analyzing and creating solutions to integrate transcriLuminexRNA-seq), TCR repertoire (Rep-seq), deep immunophenotyping (flow cytometry), microbiome (metagenomics), cytokines (luminex) and clinical (eCFR) data.'], ['Research Internship', 'Université Pierre et Marie Curie', 'Oct 2017 - Jan 2018 · 4 mos', 'Région de Paris, France', 'To link actomyosin dynamics at the cell level to the biochemical properties of the actin assembly machinery, we will initially focus on the formin CYK-1. Using CRISPR-based technology of genome editing, I will replanucleator/elongatorgator domain of the formin CYK-1 by homologous domains from other species, in order to modulate biochemical properties in a predictable manner. I will then analyze dynamics of this chimeric formin on actin dynamics in vivo. In parallel, I will develop an optogenetics approach based on the CRY-2/CIB-1 system to modulate the concentration of actin assembly factors in live embryos.'], ['Master research internship', 'Université de Paris -Institute Jacques Monod · Full-time', 'Jan 2017 - Aug 2017 · 8 mos', 'Région de Paris, France', 'Study of the cellular and molecular processes of the formation of the gastro-vascular network in the jellyfish Aurelia. (Bio-Physics) Developmental biology is science of how biological form changes with the time. Development occurs normally in Embryos, tissues and in complex animal in body part. The aim of the study is to illustrate the morphology in the formation of gastro vascular system formation in ephyra and medusa. During my internship, to mark cell proliferation we used 5-ethynyl-2′-deoxyuridine (EdU), a thymidine analog that gets incorporated into newly synthesized DNA. During to the formation epithelium of ephyra cell layers, the ectoderm and endoderm which derived gastrodermis that lines in the grstic cavity, between the two layers mad up of gelatinous viscous mesoglea. we obeseved the complex event an during this epithlim formation that in that ephyra the gastrodermis take place In the ecoderm while in the meta-ephrya and medusa stage the grstic cavity line shown in the endoderm. We conducted this study in two phylogenetically significant metazoan models, (annelid and Aurelia) to analyse the genes responsible for patterning a vascular system across two classes which have been separated by evolutionary contrition a million years ago. We observed that fundamental mechanism of morphogenesis is conserved. However the development of one organism’s vascular –system is independent to the other model. We also study the candidate gene approach for identify the homology in our two model. We identified homologues of Platynereis genes that have been characterized as crucial in Vertebrates vasculogenesis and angiogenesis such as FGF, VEGF signaling . We performed in situ hybridization on embryo.'], ['Msc Thesis (Bio-statistics)', 'The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda - Food and Nutrition department', 'Feb 2015 - May 2015 · 4 mos', 'Région de Vadodara, Inde', 'Aspect of menopause transitionwith regards to women health to find out the reasons for the women suffering from menopause related issues and to find out the association between menopausal transition, symptom variables & thyroid disorder.']]
Education: [['Université Paris Cité', 'Interdisciplinary Lifescience, System and Synthetic Biology', '2016 - 2018'], ['Learning Planet Institute', "Master's degree, Life Science Research", '2016 - 2018'], ['The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda', "Master's degree, Biostatistics", '2013 - 2015'], ['Sardar Patel Vidyalaya', 'Bachelor of Applied Science - B.Sc, Genetics', '2010 - 2013']]

Name: 8011b850344dc43675e2da8e6d4f1545
Position: Postdoctoral Research Fellow at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (Prof Roger D Kamm's lab)
Experience: [['Postdoctoral Research Fellow', 'Massachusetts Institute of Technology · Contract', 'Nov 2020 - Present · 1 yr 7 mos', 'Cambridge, Massachusetts, United States', "Prof Roger D Kamm's lab"], ['PhD Student', 'IAB (Institut Albert Bonniot) - Université Grenoble Alpes - Tardieux lab', 'Oct 2016 - Jul 2020 · 3 yrs 10 mos', 'Grenoble Area, France', 'Toxoplasma research, biology, biophysics, imaging, mathematics'], ['Research Internship (Dr Valerie Taly group)', 'Université Paris Descartes', 'Apr 2016 - Jul 2016 · 4 mos', 'Paris Area, France', '"Resistance prediction to targeted cancer treatment with microfluidic platforms" The acquisition of resistance to treatment by tumor cells follows Darwinian rules of survival of the fittest. Consequently, following the example of the many successful in vitro directed evolution experiments for creation of new proteins, it should be possible to recreate such processes. The aim here is to develop a new approach enabling the identification of new cancer biomarkers responsible of the emergence of resistance to specific therapies without a priori with regard to the implicated genetic alteration(s). By taking as a model the acquisition of resistance to inhibitors targeting the Tyrosine Kinase (TK) domain of the Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) in pulmonary adenocarcinoma, different microfluidics platforms are envisioned, each of which could provide interesting and complementary fundamental insights into the process of cancer resistance. The integration of droplet-based microfluidic modules already provides tools to screen large libraries of variants containing small numbers of extraordinary variants. Such approach is interesting for high-throughput screening and directed evolution experiments. Microfluidic platforms could now also constitute an unprecedented tool to understand and predict resistance to targeted cancer treatment before their highlighting on patients.'], ['Institut Curie', '7 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'Research Internship (Dr Vassili Soumelis group)', 'Jan 2016 - Mar 2016 · 3 mos', '"T-MEGA: a global analysis of tumor microenvironment role in human cancer" T-MEGA (Tumor MicroEnvironment Global Analysis) is focusing on generating a comprehensive understanding of tumor microenvironment composition and defining its role in tumor development and clinical outcome. In the frame of this program, we performed an extensive characterization of the tumor microenvironment of over 550 breast cancer patients. In brief, all the parameters relevant to the soluble and cellular tumor microenvironment are measured on the same clinical sample using a variety of high to low throughput multiplex technologies (including functional experiments). Importantly, diagnostic and follow-up clinical data are also collected. A first goal of this program is to exploit this dataset in the frame of defined biology-driven projects. These research projects include, but are not limited to: - Characterization of the role of immune and non-immune cells as well as inflammation in tumor development and clinical outcome. - Characterization of the impact of stress responses on tumor microenvironment and tumor development. - Identification of alterations in the microenvironment which are critical for the initiation of cancer cell invasion. A second, but equally important, goal of this program is to develop an integrated/system level analysis of the tumor microenvironment of human primary tumors. Biostatistical and modeling methods to mine these heterogeneous data in order to i) unravel co-segregation of biological parameters, ii) reconstruct the molecular and cellular interaction networks within the tumor microenvironement and iii) identify and validate prognostic or predictive biomarkers and identify new potential targets for therapeutic interventions. More specifically, the internship student will use the clinic-biological dataset that our laboratory has already generated (n=575 breast cancer patients) in order to find and link different parameters in the tumor microenvironment.', 'Research Internship (Dr Nicolas Manel group)', 'Sep 2015 - Dec 2015 · 4 mos', '"Development of new methods and quantification in the study of nuclear envelope breaching and consequences in immune responses" Migrating cells such as cancer cells and immune cells need to deform their nucleus. How this is achieved and what are the consequences of this deformation is poorly understood. In an interdisciplinary collaboration with Dr Piel\'s lab at Institut Curie, the lab uses microfabricated devices to study nuclear deformation. The lab has identified novel regulators of this mechanism, and also how nuclear deformation can activate an immune response. The specific project that the internship student will pursue will be to perform nuclear deformation experiments using immune and cancer cells expressing a nuclear deformation marker protein, and quantify deformation events as well as measure immune-related readouts. This will include microscopy experiments using microfabricated devices and image analysis and quantification using scripting computational packages.'], ['Research Internship in Cancer research (Prof Vasilios Gorgoulis lab)', 'University of Athens, School of Medicine', 'Sep 2014 - Aug 2015 · 1 yr', 'Laboratory of Histology-Embryology Molecular Carcinogenesis Group Medical School', 'In Professor Gorgoulis’s laboratory, I gained experience in cancer research by carrying out experiments in silico and in wet-lab. I tried to become familiar with techniques such as western blots, cell culture, plasmid extraction and virus transfection. Moreover, I performed mathematical modelling for the cdc6 and p53 protein by using ODEs and this modelling was used for publication.'], ['Team leader in summer camp for children', 'Replayce The Alternative Education System', 'Jun 2015 - Jul 2015 · 2 mos', 'Athens, Greece', 'Team leader in a summer school for children 6-14 years old. Activities: Olympic games training, theatre, trips.'], ['Synthetic gene network for associative learning in yeast - Dissertation project', 'University of Aberdeen', 'Jan 2014 - Sep 2014 · 9 mos', 'Aberdeen, United Kingdom', 'Dissertation project:\ufeff Synthetic gene network for associative learning under supervision of Dr Yasushi Saka. (Grade: Merit) During my master’s project, I was focused on the modelling of a synthetic gene network for associative learning by using mathematical and biological principles that I learned during my master’s courses. Mostly, I used Michaelis-Menten kinetics and ODEs. After this, I started building the gene network by carrying out wet-lab experiments. My basic interest was focused on the creation of a positive feedback loop and find ways to induce and inhibit this loop experimentally. The aim of the project was to find the gene network topology behind associative learning. Computer software Mathematica and Matlab used for modelling. Budding yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae used as experimental model: genes of interest (rtTA, AIDgg1VP64, E2CTUP1, TIR1), induction of genes using doxycycline and auxin, fluorescent markers used for microscopy and flow cytometry, yeast transformation and integration techniques, yeast genetics, creation of plasmids using gateway cloning techniques, DNA manipulation techniques such as miniprep, midiprep and restriction digest. Moreover, I have some basic knowledge of working with microfluidic chips, as it was part of the project.']]
Education: [['Université Grenoble Alpes', 'Doctor of Philosophy (PhD)', '2016 - 2019'], ['Université Paris Cité', 'M2 (AIV) Internship year, Systems and Synthetic biology, Cancer research', '2015 - 2016', 'Universities of Paris Diderot and Descartes'], ['University of Aberdeen', 'Master of Science (MSc) Systems and Synthetic Biology, Biological and Biomedical Sciences', '2013 - 2014'], ['University of Crete', 'Bachelor of Science (BSc), Mathematics', '2006 - 2013'], ['3rd Lyceum of Chalkida', '2003 - 2006']]

The research integrates tissue engineering and biomechanical approaches to designing and characterizing artificial tendons for use in shoulder repair surgery.', 'ORS_Poster_1116.pdf', "Conference abstract from the Orthopaedic Research Society's Annual Meeting in San Diego, where I gave a poster talk about my clinical research in shoulder mechanics.", 'Perkins_ISL&T_CSA_Study.pdf', 'Conference abstract from the International Symposium on Ligaments & Tendons in San Diego, where I gave a poster talk about my preclinical research in shoulder mechanics.'], ['Research Intern in Atherosclerosis', 'Ecole Polytechnique', 'May 2015 - Aug 2015 · 4 mos', 'Palaiseau, France', "Worked in the Barakat lab group under École Polytechnique's Laboratoire D'Hydrodynamique. Because atherosclerosis develops preferentially in regions where blood flow is disturbed and where ECs have a cuboidal morphology, the interplay between EC shape and mechanotransduction events is of primary interest.\r \r Cite this article as: Lafaurie-Janvore, J., Antoine, E.E., Perkins, S.J. et al. Biomed Microdevices (2016) 18: 63. doi:10.1007/s10544-016-0090-y'], ['Research Intern in Infectious Disease', 'Columbia University in the City of New York', 'Oct 2014 - Feb 2015 · 5 mos', 'New York, NY', "Designed improved personal protective equipment for aid-workers in West Africa fighting the Ebola epidemic. Such a tool could be of great interest for improving our understanding of bacteria: characterizing oxidative stress defense and recovery, monitoring growth media component consumption rates, or just making sure the culture you left Friday evening in the lab is in the same state on Monday morning.', 'iGEM Grenoble 2012 - sEnsiColi', 'We built an ultra-sensitive pathogen detector. The detection module consists of a recombinant membrane receptor that, once activated, actuates an amplification loop. The amplification system contains a genetic feed forward loop, which filters out false positive outputs. Once amplified and filtered, the signal is transmitted to neighboring bacteria via a diffusible molecule. In turn, the amplification loop is triggered which leads to the production of a measurable fluorescence output.', 'iGEM Grenoble 2011 - MercuroColi', 'Our project aims at constructing a sensor capable of quantifying the concentration of mercury, in an aqueous sample. It is based on a comparison between an unknown mercury concentration and a known IPTG concentration. When the mercury solution is added, bacteria become either “sender” or “receiver”. Senders will release a quorum sensing molecule. Receivers will induce the expression of a red dye at a position in the IPTG gradient from which the unknown mercury concentration can be deduced.'], ['Université Grenoble Alpes', '3 yrs 1 mo', 'Région de Grenoble, France', 'Chercheur junior (doctorant)', '2011 - 2014 · 3 yrs', "Identification des mécanismes de l'inhibition de la croissance bactérienne d'E. coli par la construction et la caractérisation métabolique de mutants proposition et élaboration d'un sujet veille scientifique mise en place de protocoles gestion de projet expérimentation capacité d'analyse et de synthèse reporting rédaction et présentation orale collaboration à plusieurs projets encadrement de 3 stagiaires", "Mécanismes de l'inhibition de la croissance par l'acétate chez Escherichia coli", "L'acétate nuit à la croissance de la bactérie E. coli. Malgré les recherches qui tentent d'en d'écrire les raisons, il nous est impossible actuellement de fournir le schéma explicatif complet de ce phénomène. Cette thèse propose de déterminer l'importance des différents mécanismes possibles de l'inhibition de la croissance par l'acétate.", 'Formateur (moniteur)', '2011 - 2014 · 3 yrs', "Enseignement de Microbiologie, Génétique des Procaryotes et Biochimie - Implications phylogénétiques', 'Internship Master 2 - AIV - CRI - PARIS', 'Sep 2017 - Dec 2017 · 4 mos', 'Institut de Systématique, Evolution, Biodiversité', 'Analyse de la variation morphologique des vertèbres : Utilisation de la 3D et de la morphogéometrie 3D'], ['Stage étudiant M2 :Analyse morphométrique de la colonne cervicale des oiseaux (Aves)', "Museum national d'Histoire naturelle", 'Jan 2017 - Jun 2017 · 6 mos', 'MECADEV mécanismes adaptatifs & évolution', "Analyse morphométrique de la colonne cervicale des oiseaux et détermination d'un lien entre la longueur des vertèbres, le mode de vie, le milieu de vie ainsi que la phylogénie des espèces."], ["FOUILLES PALEONTOLOGIQUES D'ANGEAC-CHARENTE", "Museum national d'Histoire naturelle, Musée d'Angoulême", 'Jul 2016 · 1 mo', 'Charente'], ['Stage étudiant M1 : Etude de plusieurs méthodes de conservation pour différents fossiles', "Museum national d'Histoire naturelle", 'Mar 2016 · 1 mo', "Museum national d'Histoire naturelle", 'Dans les Museum, les collections sont très riches en spécimens fossiles. La recherche en paléontologie se base sur ces collections pour pouvoir faire avancer cette science, comprendre les évènements passés pour étudier l’actuel. Pour pouvoir étudier les fossiles il faut pouvoir les garder en bon état, pour qu’ils ne se dégradent pas. Il est nécessaire de les protéger pour qu’ils perdurent dans le temps. Les méthodes de protection sont très diversifiées. Elles vont du simple support à la protection totale du spécimen. Développer les techniques les plus optimales est une nécessité pour protéger au maximum les fossiles. Les protections et supports en plâtre font parti des premières méthodes utilisées dans la conservation. Aujourd’hui encore elles sont très présentes. Mais l’étude et la comparaison avec les techniques à base de résine montrent que les chapes en plâtre semblent moins adaptées pour le transport et le déplacement des spécimens. Les techniques à bases de résine sont très développées au sein du Museum d’ Histoire Naturelle de Paris. Beaucoup de spécimens sont aujourd’hui protégés par des chapes en résine qui les isolent de la poussière et de l’humidité. Mais, cette technique mise en place depuis une trentaine d’années seulement, il est difficile de savoir si elle perdure correctement dans le temps.']]

Position: Co-Founder at Gouach. Building repairable electric batteries 🔋 for a sustainable e-mobility 🚲. 🚀 We're hiring! 😍
Experience: [['Co-Founder', 'Gouach · Permanent', 'May 2021 - Present · 1 yr 1 mo', 'Bordeaux, Nouvelle-Aquitaine, France', "Gouach is the the first fully repairable electric battery. It comes packed with outstanding features, like out-of-the-box connectivity and sequential-discharge, as well as many optimizations to make it last longer! At Gouach, we're fighting alongside you, for less planned obsolescence, more eco-friendly mobility, and a better climate for all!"], ['Pledger', 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/founders-pledge', 'Sep 2015 - Present · 6 yrs 9 mos', "I'm a member of Founder's Pledge, a community dedicated to improving how we fund solutions to the world's most pressing challenges. The Founders Pledge team provides charity research and vetting, a global network of experts, and end-to-end giving infrastructure, and they take no cuts and charge no fees. They also host community events across the globe. Name: 09942a4dc57aca0e2ca535de5611665b
Position: Education Project Manager
Experience: [['Contributor', 'Observatoire des Camps de Réfugiés', 'Jan 2022 - Present · 5 mos', 'Paris, Île-de-France, France', 'Working as part of the America Zone task-force while contributing to the Brazilian anual report. This task force has the goal of reporting the general state of camps and shelters in the Boa Vista and Pacaraima area in the light of the Venezuelan forced migration.'], ['Co-founder & Head of Partnerships', 're:Start', 'Jun 2017 - Present · 5 yrs', 'Paris Area, France', "Re:Start began its activity opening a space to refugees and asylum seekers to learn highly demanded skills in order to promote their inclusion into the tech industry. Currently, we're continuing to co-create opportunities with newcomers in France; holding workshops and events to build digital, transversal and social skills, while being creative, playful and reflective. Co-founder of the re:Start Association, currently my work is focused on 1) Career guidance and support system for newcomers in France in an action research framework, 2) Design of digital literacy training courses and 3) the development of partnerships in the field of adult education for displaced populations in France and abroad. More info: www.restart-asso.org"], ['Education Project Manager', 'Beecome.io', 'Aug 2019 - Jun 2021 · 1 yr 11 mos', 'Montreuil Area, France', 'Work developed in close relationships with partner schools and higher education institutions while counseling for technological and pedagogical good practices. Ground support and supervision of implementation phase: training of trainers, meetings and workshops with higher education stakeholders. Feedback collection from users (students, professors and administrative staff members) and translation into functional roadmap.'], ['Education Project Manager - LATAM', 'JEGLABS', 'Aug 2019 - Jun 2021 · 1 yr 11 mos', 'Montreuil, Île-de-France, France', 'Working with the implementation of JegLabs educational products in Latin America: Beecome, TestWe and Omniscol'], ['Project Manager', 'LearnSpace', 'Oct 2018 - Mar 2019 · 6 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'Project manager at LearnSpace working on East-West Africa benchmark of EdTech start ups, innovation and people changing the face of education. Design and facilitation of trainings and learning expeditions.'], ['International Outreach & Partnerships', 'Rhizome Association', 'Sep 2018 - Mar 2019 · 7 mos', 'My work consisted in facilitating international partnerships both logistically and pedagogically. We believe that outreach begets local partnerships therefore the engineering of the pedagogical program is always co-developed with local partners who are on the ground. Community building is what the Rhizome Association is all about.', 'The Rhizome Association', 'The Rhizome Association represents our vision of future education, based on active learning, skills development and interdisciplinary projects in science, arts and civic engagement. The goal of our association is to develop and implement educational programs and interdisciplinary projects, the first ones being focused on interdisciplinary life sciences.'], ['Pedagogical Engineer', 'INSERM', 'Jan 2018 - Jun 2018 · 6 mos', 'Paris Area, France', 'Worked on the "GMO Detective" project an open science initiative lead by Guy Aidelberg. My worked consisted in the optimization of molecular biology techniques used in the DNA detection prototype developed as well as in the pedagogical design required for its use in different learning environments.', 'Inserm u1001', 'The “Robustness and Evolvability of Life”, jointly funded by INSERM (French National Institute of Health and Medical Research) and Paris Descartes University is composed of two research teams: “Avoidance and Repair of Biological Damage” and “Systems Engineering and Evolution Dynamics”. The laboratory is located in the Paris Descartes Medical Faculty building at the center of Paris.'], ['Minima Biodesign Project - Top 8 finalist', 'Biodesign Challenge', 'Oct 2017 - Jun 2018 · 9 mos', 'Greater New York City Area', 'Minima, the elementary biology lab, was designed by me and a team of students from Ecole Boulle. It was selected among the finalists projects of the BioDesign Challenge, an interdisciplinary competition dedicated to combine biology and design. My work in this project was to provide scientific and technical approaches as of the development of the prototype. The goal of the kit, designed in a really minimalistic and beautiful way, was to change the way people think about their food and about biotechnology, making it something everyone can feel, see and more importantly, understand. http://minimabiolab.org/', 'MINIMA at BioDesign Challenge', 'The BioDesign Challenge is organised, since 2015, by Genspace (Brooklyn based Biohackerspace) at MoMA in New York City. This international student competition which sits at the intersection between Design & Science, offers university students in Design and Science the opportunity to envision future applications and implications of biotechnology on our society.', 'Minima, the elementary biology lab', 'Minima, the elementary biology lab, designed by a team of students from CRI and Ecole Boulle has been selected among the finalists projects of BioDesign Challenge, the interdisciplinary competition dedicated to biology and design. The goal of the kit, designed in a really minimalistic and beautiful way, has the potential to change the way people think about their food and about biotechnology, making it something everyone can feel, see and more importantly, understand.'], ['iGEM Paris Saclay 2016', 'iGEM Competition', 'Jan 2016 - Oct 2016 · 10 mos', 'Paris e Região, França', "Member of the Association SynthéBiol Paris-Saclay and the Paris Saclay's 2016 iGEM team. The iGEM Competition is an annual event which is promoted by the MIT in the field of synthetic biology. Through the formation of multidisciplinary teams worldwide, this great international network promotes education, a healthy competition environment and open collaboration. My work in this project consisted in creating channels of communication internally and externally for the team. I was also part of the wetlab team working on experiments related to synthetic biology, genetics and molecular biology."], ['Guest Researcher', 'Charles University', 'Jan 2014 - Mar 2014 · 3 mos', 'Prague, The Capital, Czech Republic', 'Internship under the supervision of Dr. Dana Holá in the Department of Genetics and Microbiology in the Faculty of Sciences of Charles University in Prague, Czech Republic. Worked with antioxidant enzymes treated with brassinosteriods, analysis of photosynthetic process using chlorophyll fluorescence measurements and polarographic determination of photochemical activity. The internship was coordinated by the Institute of Czech-Brazilian Academic Cooperation.', 'INCBAC - INSTITUTE OF CZECH-BRAZILIAN ACADEMIC COOPERATION', 'UNIGOU Program: Program of Academic Internships for Brazilian universities.'], ['Education Project Manager', 'AIESEC', 'Jul 2013 - Dec 2013 · 6 mos', 'Campinas Area, Brazil', "Project Manager for the Education Exchange Program at the Campinas Office. The association internationale des étudiants en sciences économiques et commerciales (AIESEC) it's a student organization responsible for cultural and professional exchange programs. I worked with the recruitment of students between the age of 18 to 30 who wanted to have an international experience in the field of Education. The development of this mission was in close contact with AIESEC HQs around the world and it made me gain experience in vocational training, coaching and benchmark."], ['Institutional Scientific Initiation Scholarship Program (PIBIC)', 'Brazilian Center for Research in Energy and Materials (CNPEM)', 'Jul 2012 - May 2013 · 11 mos', 'Campinas e Região, Brasil', 'Internship under the supervision of Dr. Goldman and Dr. Velasco de Castro Oliveira at the Brazilian Nacional Laboratory of Bioethanol Science and Technology (CTBE), one of the four major laboratories that composes the Brazilian Nacional Center of Energy and Materials Research (CNPEM). Working with Microbiology Genoma (yeasts, bacteria and fungi) of the sugar cane and soil, genetical improvement and biotechnology in the process of producing Second Generation Bioethanol.', 'CTBE video (in portuguese)', 'CNPEM (in portuguese)', 'Centro Nacional de Pesquisa em Energia e Materiais']]
Education: [['Learning Planet Institute', 'MSc, Interdisciplinary and Innovative Approaches to Research and Education', '2017 - 2019', 'The Learning Sciences Master is an international interdisciplinary program dedicated to educational technology, learning sciences and digital practices. It aims at training creative and talented students to become the future change-makers of education by providing them with a global and strategic understanding of the digital transformation in education and to help them to design relevant and impactful projects.', 'Life Learning Master - Students testimonies (Mimi)', 'Join the EdTech Master Program in 2018'], ['Learning Planet Institute', 'Universitary degree - Creativity, Research, Entrepreneurship, Multi/Interdisciplinary Studies', '2016 - 2017', 'Skills developed during this training: Design thinking: Learn how to understand needs / Creation of useful solutions / Rapid prototyping / Project communication Creativity Methods: Individual and collective creativity tools / Solution-driven approaches to reach out and network efficiently / Action-taking strategies to allow good project flow Research Methods: Research impact for social and tech innovation/ Synthesis of usefull scientific knowledge for a project / Applying the scientific method of inquiry for any project https://www.cri-paris.org/en/education/du-creer'], ['Pontifícia Universidade Católica de Campinas', "Bachelor's degree, Biology/Biological Sciences", '2011 - 2015', 'Biology - PUC-Campinas (in portuguese)'], ['Université Paris-Saclay', "Bachelor's degree (L3), Biologie Santé", '2015 - 2016']]

Name: 6de2cd2a037a029871babb97ce7d8188
Position: Doctorant en biophysique chez Institut Curie
Experience: [['Doctorant en biophysique', 'Institut Curie', 'Sep 2011 - Present · 10 yrs 9 mos', 'Région de Paris, France', "Le travail de doctorant que j'effectue consiste au développement de protocole et d'instrumentation dans le but d'apporter des réponses physiques au domaine de la biologie.
